Posts.Title: Trying to stay calm pattybelle pattybelle

Posts.Content: pattybelle wrote: I am 45, went for regular mammogram on April 24. On April 28, I received a letter telling me I had an abnormality and needed to call for more testing. Got in the next day (thank you, God), for more digital views and ultrasound. Radiologist found an abnormal mass, Bi-rads 4, and advised me to consult with my doctor. Got into surgeon on May 4, he first suggested needle biopsy while working to pull up my digital mammogram and ultrasound. After viewing both, came back and said we had two options. First, lumpectomy. Second, watch aggressively and wait. I told him to take it OUT. So, I'm scheduled for wire loc, excisional biopsy on Tuesday, May 19. I'm scared, and I feel guilty, because I had noticed that my left breast had grown considerably larger than the left. I had written it off to perimenopausal changes, and the fact that I had began a pretty agressive excercise program this year. (Thought I was simply over-developing left pecs). My sister and two children (19 and 22) are coming into town for the procedure and I don't know how to deal with keeping them calm. ...not to mention myself calm. I'm having outrageous anxiety. Any thoughts? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Trying to stay calm pattybelle pattybelle

Posts.Content: pattybelle wrote: Went for second opinion in Salt Lake City yesterday with an excellent breast surgeon who is affiliated with the Huntsman Cancer Institute. He checked out all my mammos (Birads 4) and ultrasound, did a physical exam, and then did a core needle biopsy. He was so reassuring, said it didn't "feel" like cancer, but he wanted to get the pathology done to be sure. He said if there was anything atypical at all on the pathology, he would do an excisional biopsy. I felt so relieved after seeing him, like I was finally in really competent hands. I'm so glad my ob/gyn referred me to him. I'm a little sore today, but really it is minor. He said we should have results tomorrow and asked me to call him first thing (so much nicer than...we will call you...). The 220 mile drive was so worth every minute. Peace to all awaiting resul.ts, and may your doctors be as awesome as Dr. Noyes. Patty Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Core Needle Biopsy Yesterday pattybelle pattybelle

Posts.Content: May 18, 2009 05:20PM pattybelle wrote: Had a very busy weekend doing things I love, so I'm as calm as can be expected for tomorrow morning.Didn't sleep much, but usually sleep well after anesthesia, so should catch up tomorrow afternoon. The surgeon's nurse phoned this AM and was very sweet as she gave me the pre-op third degree.  I feel better knowing I have you all there to talk to afterwards as I wait for a diagnosis. I live in the middle of no where, so I'm expecting to wait the full 7-10 days. Peace be with you all. Patty
Posts.Title: Trying to stay calm pattybelle pattybelle

Posts.Content: May 26, 2009 01:59PM pattybelle wrote: Ladies, all your good vibes were very GOOD! They found nothing to biopsy that morning when they went to do the wire location. I was released with orders for a three month check-up after the redioligist and surgeon consulted and the surgeon did a physical. I don't know what happened, but I'm very thankful, and focusing on the good. I'll stay in touch.

Posts.Content: Jun 3, 2009 12:40PM pattybelle wrote: Thank you! I have an endometrial biopsy Friday ( I've been spotting for two months straight), and I'll be consulting with my GYN regarding the breast issues. I feel the need to "debrief" to make sure the suggestions of the surgeon and radiologist were sound. I have been reading the discussion boards religiously....I feel a need to stay connected, so I am going to go with that feeling. I hope that is okay. Patty

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2009 12:18PM pattybelle wrote: Well, after reviewing all mammos, my GYN was not comfortable with the decision of the surgeon and second radiologist to not biopsy...suggested I go see a breast surgeon in Salt Lake City she has been working with for years. So, I called and have an appointment for June 15. I feel more comfortable about having a specialist look at this to confirm the right decision was made.   In the meantime, awaiting results of endometrial biopsy on Friday and hoping that there's nothing wrong with my uterus, too.
